It might actually be my favorite out of all four! Can't wait for it to come out on DVD!!

Lack of character arks check, family issues check, despicable child actors check but its okay we have dinosaurs. Loud more than anything, Jurassic park strikes out with the third sequel in the the Jurassic park franchise serving as more of a satire of the original rather than a respectful follow up. Movie goers will suddenly find the lost world didn't seem as bad as you look in shame upon the big screen, but hey what else can you expect from a "summer blockbuster" or in my geographical location "winter blockbuster" other than load noises and expensive CGI, surely not interesting characters or a plot pulled out of someones ass, of course not. With the little things to look forward to being the occasional nod to the original film and the great performance of Chris Prat. There is no better way then to describe this film than in the words of Shakespeare as a film full of "sound and fury signifying nothing"

Jurassic World is the best sequel in the most exciting franchise of the film industry. Characters are likable, the dinosaurs feel so new and life-like compared to the previous films, and the music is so well done. Those who criticize the film for being terrible is just pathetic. They don't understand a Jurassic film as I do, being a Jurassic fan myself. I recommend movie-goers, kids that love dinosaurs, and fans of the films to see this amazing film.

To be honest I wasn't expecting a movie that would save the franchise as a great Dinosaur movie series. But when I saw it I was so into it and exited that I almost forgot about the last two movies and just moved on to a new and great Jurassic Park series.
Filled with nostalgia, great visuals and a fine performance from Chris Pratt, Jurassic World is satisfying sequel, without adding anything new to the franchise.

This movie did not exist ok....It sucks, it really does. The  characters are horrible and the story is just so cheap. The only thing good in this movie are the CGI which is actually pretty decent and....nothing more.

A worthwhile successor that carries much of the spectacle of the original Jurassic Park. Plenty of humor keeps things on the lighter side and an epic ending made the two hours of sitting worth while.  It could have been better, but I'm in no way sorry I saw it in theaters.  It was a little tough not thinking about "Starlord" with how Chris Pratt's character was developed.  Hopefully this is where JP ends, there's nothing good left to mine out of this franchise, unless Jeff Goldblum wants to get back in the saddle and chuckle half the script away ;)

How do you outdo a classic, let alone one that was made by one of the greatest filmmaker of all time? Well, you can start by sticking to the template, and doing everything right. Jurassic World is a thrill ride. It's a roller coaster, pure and simple. It's made by newbie Trevorrow, and his love for the material quickly shines through. Watch out for this guy..he's talented. A lot of the critics seemed to be jaded by this film. Maybe they expect more character development? Well, the original didn't have it as well. But what we have here are younger, more attractive casts, including new A-liter Chris Pratt.  But heck..the main stars were always the dinosaurs, and here they are brilliant beyond measure.   2015 proves to be a banner year for Universal, and this flick seals the deal even further.  Another billion dollar blockbuster? You bet.

Considering the footsteps its following in, Jurassic World stands on its own and makes necessary technological advances and concepts to modernize the franchise. Still, the constant thrills are the main attraction here--but, you won't be disappointed in the film's various human-dinosaur relationships reflecting life and animal captivity today.

Jurassic world may have poor character development cheesy one liners and is very predictable but the visual effects, cinematography,Action sequences and the very likable lead Chris Pratt as Owen Grady combine together to make a fantastic popcorn blockbuster

Like Alan Grant in Jurassic Park, I would ask Director Colin Trevorrow 'How did you do this?'. Firstly Jurassic Park is one of my all time favourite movies. I saw it when I was 11 and loved it ever since. As for the sequels, The Lost World is watch-able and Jurassic Park III does not even deserve the JP title. The series lost its way and you would have been forgiven for thinking, as I did, that any more sequels would have no chance of being halfway decent. It defies reason then that Trevorrow can come to this franchise with only one film under his belt and produce the best sequel to Jurassic Park. Not only that but Trevorrow set out to recreate the feeling of what it was like to watch the first film back in 1993 and for me he damn near succeeded. The only thing that stopped it feeling like a full 1993 nostagia package was that I had seen the dinosaurs before. Everything I had been concerned with in the trailers just works. Chris Pratt and the Raptors - its great! The I-Rex is genuinely the scariest creature since JP's T-Rex. And as for the T-Rex, his reappearance later in the movie was entirely predictable, highly anticipated and awesome. The whole film feels like a breath of fresh air with a promising future that entirely ignores parts two and three. I can't wait to see it again . . . it can't be as good as I remember can it?

I loved this movie! The story is quite simple, even kind of dumb sometimes, but it works perfectly to set up everything for what we really want... Dinosaurs! I think people should watch Jurassic World with an open mind and the disposition to be awe. The dinosaurs are wonderful and are breathtaking; as for the humans, they do what they are suppose to do... Be eaten. Pratt does a terrific job on his role. In summary: Fun movie, great visual effects, tons of dinosaurs, dumb ye effective story.

It might not reach the inspiration and amusement level of Steven Spielberg's Jurassic Park back in 1993 but all the hard work to keep the story faithfully to the original has overall expands the dinosaurs park into a world of an entertaining popcorn thriller. Having screenwriters from Rise of the Planet of the Apes' franchise, the engineering field of genetic modification works efficiently on the historic extincted animals and at the same time allows the plot to stress on the greediness of human nature, the ethical and morality behind as well as the dire consequences. Scores from Michael Giacchino mostly remain the original theme composed by John Williams, creating a sense of revisiting the old park while performance of Chris Pratt sparks with his serious characteristic throughout the entire film. The story is further well balanced with intense action sequences, fury battle between the dinosaurs and splendid visual effects although there's a few scenes of obvious CGI flaws. Overall, director Colin Trevorrow has transformed this mid-range Spielberg efforts into a satisfying adventure much better than the previous two sequels - The Lost World: Jurassic Park and Jurassic Park III.

I loved it , i really believe they brought back the magic of the first movie, i could wait to see what was coming, the movie surprised me a bunch of times, Everyone has to see this movie and if it keeps going the way it is, everyone will see it. Its definitely the best movie of the summer.

The story and scope demand for a fresher bigger concept, it entertains and has great moments, but then the budget in the hands of a youthful director relay some charismatic and sensical lacking bite to it. But he did a very good job with the script he had, but nonetheless put aside the nitpicks, for me it was a little less than equal to that of Lost World but better than the 3rd one, Jurassic World is a fun time at the movies I will see few times again.

Jurassic World is a thriller action movie with certain instances of cute dinosaurs that makes it a well rounded movie. It was clear from the start what the problem was going to be, but I found most of the movie was unpredictable and put me on the edge of my seat just when I was starting to feel comfortable there would be not jump scares.

When i first heard of the movie and the gene modification stuff, teaching dinosaurs and so, i got really worried. I thought that it could go the wrong way or in a good way.Fortunately, for me, it went the right direction. The Indomitus, the most proeminent aspect of that new approach isn't an aberration. Instead, he is clever, dangerous and use several natures best hunting tactics and, foremost, he hunts for sport! It's a unstoppable killing machine and impose a lot of fear. Speaking of which, i saw i different kind of terror/fear in this movie and i liked it! The deaths are pretty scary, mostly because the directors decisions about camera angles. But not only that, the soundtrack and the situations cause a large sensation of fear, it captured the fear of death right before people got caugth by their nemesis. It deviates from previous movies, which, for me, were much more cartooned-like. It's a psicologycal terror, the fear before death that really added to the more dark atmosphere of the movie. In this movie, i felt the wheight of the deaths, the effects on people and it impacted me a lot. Another point that i feared that could go the wrong way was the raptors  training. I expected that they did that in a silly form, you know, like, "hey rex, go get that bone". But it wasn't like that at all. Instead, that aspect is very intriguing, and the spectator stays apprehensive all the time, because you never know if the raptors will attack or if they will act accordingly. Its very unpredictable and sounds very much like how it would be if that really happened, so is another point of the movie that overlapped my  expectations.  The plot is acceptable and so the carachters. A bonus and praise for Crhis Pratt, wich, for me made a solid carachter and conducted is role very well. His caracther is cool, without loose that sense of responsability. For  those who says he could be more funny like his previous roles, like Guardians of The Galaxy, i disagree. That role need a strong and responsibility man and a funny guy wouldn't fit in the genre.The dinos are fine e vast and the (spoiler) King is back, so i couldn't asked for more. They are everything i wanted to see. No feathers and others stuffs. Just the old and gold reptiliam gore!!!!!! I think that compare it to the first movie is a sin. Is like compare Alien with Aliens, both have their own merits and are good in their peculiar aspects, because they have diferent goals. That is the way i see Jurassic World, no need for comparisons. Ultimately, i think the movie pay respect for the previous movies and is very nostalgic at times, but without disconnecting from its own reality, and that is definitely what this movie is about! We are not in 1993. We have technology, people got tired of the same dinos and the movie brought all that new stuff without losing its soul. For all that said i consider this a very very good movie and i loved every moment of it.

Not as i had expected. Acting is well done and funny at moments. The visuals and CGI is well done. But the story concluded made me feel like it was Godzilla 2014. The first Jurassic park is no doubt the best and the two others were bad. This one finds itself in the middle. If you were a fan on the original you will be pleased and if you were not a fan then might not like it. References are the best especially if they are not canon. Bringing back things no matter how small make you look back on your childhood after watching this. But in every now and then action movie there has to be a child actor for the kids. But for once make a movie without kids and just make the badassery with Chris Pratt and stop luring away from the action to something we don't care about. What we want in a dinosaur movie is dinosaurs.

Director Colin Trevorrow’s “Jurassic World” ushers in the next stage of summer blockbusters for 2015 this week. Starring Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard the film plays as a direct sequel to the original “Jurassic Park” released 22 years ago this week. Both “The Lost World: Jurassic Park” & “Jurassic Park III” are still considered a part of the shared universe but neither of the latter films are referenced. Instead “Jurassic World” plays up the nostalgia of the first film and has many included references. The film is definitely a must see of the summer and does play better than both of the previous sequels. Unfortunately it cannot compete with the awe and wonder one felt watching the first film in the series back in 1993. A simple formula is followed in this film which should surprise no one. Man creates dinosaurs, dinosaurs eat man, man brings Chris Pratt in to fight dinosaurs, and scene. As simple as it sounds though it still works. Pratt is the real deal and the whole time I was watching the film I felt like I was watching an audition tape for a new Indiana Jones movie. The man is fun to watch and believable in his role. Bryce Dallas Howard flies under the radar early in the film but then really starts to shine as the film goes on. Her character was also the most unbelievable element in a film full of dinosaurs though by being in high heels the entire time. The supporting cast was good with Vincent D’Onofrio, Irrfan Khan, Jake Johnson, Omar Sy, Judy Greer, Lauren Lapkus, and “Jurassic Park” alum BD Wong. I especially liked Khan’s role as Simon Masrani. D’Onofrio’s character was interesting before turning into a walking cliché by the third act. Now onto my only real gripe with the film, the kids. The performances were fine but I found neither actor, Ty Simpkins or Nick Robinson, to be charismatic or enthralling in any way. I didn’t care what was happening to them or what was going on in their lives. It is another pointless child inclusion storyline that Hollywood includes in their films because I guess they think it appeals to a broader audience. I must say though when I was a kid I didn’t care about if there were kids in the movie in a significant role. I just wanted to see whatever the heroes were doing against the dinosaurs, monsters, aliens, etc. This brings me to the thing we all want to see, the dinosaurs. They were thrilling and wonderful to see as always. I felt the rush of excitement from my 8-year old self finally getting to see an Ankylosaurus, one of my favorite dinosaurs growing up, in action on the big screen. By the end of the film everything culminates into a fantastic dino-action scene; high heels and all. So go to the theater, grab that rail seat, and kick up your feet for an enjoyable dinosaur experience. Don’t blink or you’ll miss Jeff Goldblum and Jimmy Buffet’s small inclusions. Buffet’s was especially humorous.

If you're looking for some fun, excitement and great special effects this is definitely the movie for you. It does a great job of taking the spirit of the original Jurassic Park and moving the story forward as John Hammond once envisioned. The actors do a great job of channeling great excitement and drama throughout the movie with a pleasant touch of comedy. Take the movie for what it's supposed to be not what the critics think it should be; Fun.
Jurassic World is a real success with a good screenplay and a very good special effects. The relation based on respect between Owen and raptors is a good idea. The actors play very well their roles.

If you're looking for an Oscar winner keep on walking by this one. This a Summer Blockbuster to its core, but if you want to escape some of the summer heat and relive some of your childhood buy yourself a ticket to Jurassic World.

Jurassic World is more science fiction than the first Jurassic Park.  I mean, we have the "Dr. Frankenstein" Dr. Henry Wu that I found surprisingly the true villain in the movie.  The computer animation could use a little work, but it sure does look better than the Lost World does.  I loved to see the dinosaurs, and even the new hybrid looked pretty cool!  It is sure worth looking at it in 3-D, and it will more than likely have your heart pounding in some scenes.  The raptors I can't understand, though.  They are not near as fierce as they are in the first, and they look different.  It's not like Jurassic Park 3 though.  They looked ridiculous.  Some people think this is a monster movie, but I think it is a movie with our relationship with animals.  Some people don't see that, but I do.  And Jurassic World was very well made.
JurassicWorld's graphic is so cool....for me its the best movie ive ever seen :... thumbs up for the cast ..and wish that theres another movie like this one...

This movie is the perfect tribute to the original one, with thrilling effects, excellent actors and a good story it amazing, THE BEST DINOSAUR MOVIE I'VE EVER SEEN. The first one is a classic and a masterpiece but this movie is still amazingly incredible :D!

Whenever a movie comes out, especially a reboot or a different kind of sequel, comparisons will be made to the original. For Jurassic World, the hype and the expectations were staggering. Can it beat the original? Can it put the other two non satisfying sequels to shame? The answer is that one of these objectives was accomplished while one will perhaps never be accomplished. Jurassic World takes place 20 years after the original "accident" with Hammond's park thriving with attendance and focus groups, everything we've come to expect from Corporate America (wink wink). To help boost attendance, or perhaps wallets, a new hybrid will be debuting. The problem is the hybrid has been kept in isolation and soon figures out, I don't deserve to be in a cage I deserve to create havoc. While much of the plot seems unoriginal, credit must be given to the filmmakers for paying homage to Spielberg. As Spielberg continues to make movies, his style of filmmaking becomes quite present and in return, if one follows the blueprint, you have an homage. This is not an unsatisfying reboot, but certainly does not live up to expectations.

This movie is on par with the original Jurassic Park, I was worried it was going to be some CGI fest and crazy unbelievable story about "modified dino's that can talk" , thankfully the story, atmosphere, acting, cast, and even the CGI was good. I really don't have a bad thing to say about this movie, even small things like Jake Johnson's role and how they removed the "generic kiss the girl" before she leaves scene was pleasing and funny.. , if you enjoyed the original you most likely will enjoy this one. 9/10

I've only seen the original Jurassic Park (not II or III) so I'm not the biggest fan of the series. Let me just say that Jurassic World blew my slightly low expectations out of the water. It has great visual effects, likable characters, and thankfully, very few jump scares. If I remember correctly, the movie may be a bit more violent than the original but it's still a very fun and great movie to watch.
This movie reminds me of education and I love it so so much. The special effects are excellent. The acting is incredible. The setting is so outstanding.

Jurassic World is 100x better than the original. This is definitely on my top 5 movies I have ever seen. You will enjoy this in IMAX 3D experience. The movie is so good and Chris Pratt might just be my favorite actor of all time. Please make this earn money than the Avengers and hopefully Avatar.
Movie was really great! Great to see B.D. Wong reprises as Henry Wu. Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard did a phenomenal job! I'm so happy to finally see this movie!! The theme soundtrack is back!

Being a 90s kid I grew up on these movies. Being born in 1993 and the Jurassic Park movie releasing in 1993 these movies were always my favorite. Not just for the thrill but for the love of dinosaurs in general. I went and saw Jurassic World the day of release. There's honestly not a negative thing I can say about this movie. Taking a movie that came out over a decade ago and revolutionizing it to fit a modern appeal was not an easy thing to do. Going from the original Park being a private opening, and going to a Park open to the public there is a lot of things that would have needed to be done to make it the way it should be. the only negative thing I can say about this movie is it should not have been released in 3D. It's kind of a cheesy way to present this movie. But that's my opinion only. If you are a big jurassic park fan and love all of the books and movies, then you should not be disappointed with this movie. I saw it on  the 12th and am already wanting for it to come out on Blueray. Comparing this movie to the original is like comparing a 1920 car to a 2015 car, there's no reason for it, the originality of the first Jurassic Park is great, but this is a sequel not a "original movie". I would love to see this series booted back up into more movies or possibly even a TV show to see how Ingen rebuilds.

One of the best actions movies I have ever seen. Amazing and likable characters, fun jokes, cool ideas, amazing theme park and of course huge and interrsting dinos. This movie itself is like a theme park, and huge emotional ride till the very end. 10/10

This movie was so amazing and I loved it. I have been waiting for this movie for 14 years and it was definitely worth the wait. Definitely better than the third movie and possibly the second one, it was so enjoyable to watch and reminded me why I love this franchise. Also all the people who gave this movie very negative reviews are just major butt hurts who wouldn't  know a good movie if it hit them in the face. Also to all those who say it's not as good as the original, that's true because you'll never be able to capture the awe and wonderment of the first movie again, but you can't keep rating that as a big negative point. So all the people who keep calling this movie terrible and all kinds of other horrible things are honest idiots who don't have any taste in movies.

The Jurassic World Park itself was visually stunning and felt so realistic, I had no problem imagining it was real. In fact, if not for the carnivorous dinosaurs in less than secure locations (pterodactyls enclosed only by a glass terrarium? Really?), I would have wished it were real so I could visit it myself.
In movie sequels high expectations usually mean high disappointment.

Will fans of the first movie be sad/mad with Jurassic World? Yes....well on some parts. Some of the scenes were highly unnecessary. The character development in this one was below par, because I wanted to know more about them. Things would've been a lot better with Sam Neill as Dr. Alan Grant, but instead they went for the new route, which was okay......On the positive side, the movie looks great, but not the best looking movie of this year. It was nice to hear the original theme song,it really reminded me when I saw the first Jurassic Park for the first time with the opening sequence of the island. The action was good, and I guess the third act of this film was worth the admission. So is it better than Jurassic Park 3? Yes. Is it better than the first Jurassic Park? That's a BIG NO!! Despite some of the unnecessary scenes and dumb characters, the movie was fun....mindless fun to be exact.
Pleasantly surprised :) Stop reading reviews and go see it.
While Jurassic World is definitely not as good as the timeless classic, it is an enjoyable little thrill ride that is self contained and aware of its ridiculous premise...

This movie is just pure fun and fan service for Jurassic Park fans, but it shouldn't really be taken seriously as then the stupidity of the characters come into question. There are a few scenes of said stupidity that irritated me, and depending on your tolerance level it may end up ruining the movie. Plus this movie is pretty much a giant cliche and i think it knows that and revels in it. Typical story of man trying to control nature, nature fights back, nature always wins, and man trying to play god by creating an abomination. But next to Mad Max this is a must see!
"Hold on to your butts".

This movie was pretty entertaining! You shouldn't be going in this movie thinking that it's going to be the best movie in the last decade, because it's not. It's basically a monster flick. Chris Pratt does a great job in his role! I laughed at the product placement in this movie but it was nothing to hinder my experience. The only gripe I had this movie was the CGI, sometimes it looked spot on, but towards the end it was meh. Wish they used more animetronics like they did in the original.
Jurassic World is not  good and thrilling as Jurassic Park, but offers great visual effects and a perfect new cast. Collin Trevorrow did an excellent job with this action-packed summer blockbuster.

The Movie itself was, like many criticised, nothing special, if we only look at the story arc and so on. HOWEVER, to me it did a lot of things, that I expected to be in the first films - like an actual park. The movie made me feel like a child again, and the finale even made me drop my jaw (like, for real). Another positve aspect is, that It was not to childish, in fact I think it was quite brutal for a 12+ rating.
Jurassic World is a great movie and may not exceed the first film, but personally I loved it and recommended, it is honestly one of the best films of 2015!

Jurassic World is an entertaining, funny and surprising film, may not exceed the first film, but it is much better than second and third films, I loved it and recommend it, it is certainly one of the best films of 2015!

I think it is the best movie of the year so far! I watched it last friday, after the movie I walked out of the cinema and I just thought 'WOOOOW'. So I don't understand the people who say the movie is not good.

Jurassic Park is my favorite movie and best movie in the series. But I have seen it too many times, I am bored with it. I wanted something new. Therefore, I thought Jurassic World was great. Just like people in Jurassic World, I wanted to see new dinosaurs. There were many new dinosaurs and many new types of scenes. There were many things I never expected to happen. My favorite scene was INDOMINUS REX’s ending. I really loved the VELOCIRAPTOR, TYRANNOSAURUS and MOSASAURUS. My favorite dinosaurs was VELOCIRAPTOR. Now I also like MOSASAURUS. Maybe my favorite. If there is going to be a sequel. I want to see most scenes set on under the water.
Um filme muito bom, me prendeu do inicio ao fim, e olha que nem achei que seria tão bom assim, me surpreendeu. Fiquei bem tenso durante o filme. kkk Ansioso por uma sequência.

Said in a truly respectful manner to the Jarassic movies that date back to the 1990s.  Jurassic World, is probably the best Jurassic Park movie, ever.  They definitely got it right.  It is safe to disregard movie critics who did not give this movie five stars.  Instead listen to movie goers who are jamming the movie theaters in record numbers, breaking records.

This movie is by no means better than the original, but it can settle for second best. The CGI was actually pretty good, the actors did a good job for what they had, and the overall look of the movie is enough to make even the harshest movie critics leave at least some positive notes. Now, some elements were bad, like some cheesy humor, but, if you are a fan of Jurassic Park, you will most likely have learned to ignore all the negatives. The movie is most certainly not for people looking for a possible Best Picture contender, but is an enjoyable and fun movie. Parental Guidance is required if any young ones are looking to see their favorite dinos chase people around the mountains of Isla Nublar, but they shouldn't be having nightmares when they go to sleep (unless of course they are bothered watching humans become dino food. I mean, what kind of dinosaur movie has humans and dinosaurs on the same island and no one dies? Trust me, no one would watch that movie). So, this movie is not disappointing, unless of course you dislike Jurassic Park, or dinosaurs for some reason, but, if you did, then why the heck are you watching it?

It's an incredibly fun movie and accomplishes everything it sets out to do. The dinos look awesome and the ending is amazing only thing that could of made it a 10 in my eyes is just a tad more of the T.rex

If you have love for and are a huge fan of the original, you will love this movie. Still no match to the original but close enough to appreciate the effort. I enjoyed the nostalgic feeling, thank you.

I feel like everyone giving this a low score is disappointed about it not being the same like the first one. People should get over this, there won't  ever be a movie that has the magic of the first one. Not in the age where we are used to special effects and CGI. This was a very good movie, sometimes a bit more over the top than the first ones, but that's ok.

Steven Spielberg is back on board as an executive producer and is directed by Colin Trevorrow (‘Safety Not Guaranteed’) thank god Joe Johnston did not direct this film. Jurassic World was everything John Hammond wanted this place to be, but since the dinosaurs were lose in Jurassic Park (1993) and the park was at risk it was obvious that it was not to be released in the public’s eye. Jurassic world is fully operational and the lab created a hybrid dinosaur that will attract more visitors once this thing gets out it will eat people, (okay this film does copy the first one). Jurassic World is astonishing; I was waiting for the moments in the trailer to be showed in the film and once they were showed it was awesome, it was better than the third one, this film is two hours filled with dinosaurs chasing people and eating them, people running for their lives it’s groundbreaking but it’s not even close as being good as the first one. So Bryce Dallas Howard plays Claire, she is an executive at Jurassic World she tries too hard to make Jurassic World perfect all she cares about is what the public wants. After “Guardians of the galaxy” Chris Pratt shows that he can act and he is good in this movie; so he plays Owen, a former navy man who is a Velociraptor whisper (think of him as the trainer or something), so Claire wants him to take a look at this hybrid dinosaur but he tells Claire and the lab that is a bad idea (yep this film is filled with idiots!). So Claire’s nephews Mr. Lady’s man (Nick Robinson) and his perky little brother (Ty Simpkins) come to have fun at Jurassic World, they ran away from Claire’s British assistant and have fun together at the wrong moment then the hybrid dinosaur is on the lose trying to kill for sport (what is with the script it copies off the first one). We can tell co-writer/director Colin Trevorrow loves Spielberg’s Jurassic Park franchise, the way he is behind the camera. And he tries to bring to the “Jaws” formula and collages them together I am not sure if it’s a good idea. Trevorrow and his team create new special effects that are good but it’s not fresh like Winston’s team did back in 1993. Pratt as the hero was awesome the way he brings the charisma to the project he’s like Dr. Grant’s intelligence mixed in with Ian Malcom’s humor. Bryce Dallas Howard was a great heroine in this film she is like Ellie’s charisma mixed in with John Hammond. The problem with the film is the script it has too much backstory and it tries to copy off the first one back in 1993, it does not have intense anxiety like the first one.
Me a gustado mucho, entretenida y nada pesada , tiene grandes guiños a la primera y a la segunda, en definitiva la recomiendo .
A great contender for one of the best films of the year.

This was the best movie I have seen all year and it was the best jurassic park sequel by far. However this movie was not without flaws but let's start with the positives: Chris Pratt was by far the best character in the movie and this role cements him, in my opinion, as a young star. The action was well directed and there was good comedy relief throughout the movie. The new dinosaur worked as well. The negatives are that the cgi was not convincing in some shots and I feel like directors can't just rely on cgi these days. Spielberg understood that you need to have machine dinosaurs that look perfect in close up shots. There are also two boys in this movie that didn't really add anything and kinda dragged the movie down when I wanted the movie to focus on chris and killing the dinosaurs. Also, the opening shot of the park where the  iconic music starts was just embarrasingly underwhelming. I mean the song was playing when it shows the park and the inside of a hotel! Whoopdi Doo! I didn't watch the movie to see real estate! Another thing, I mean the movie doesn't address, at all, how the hell the lawyers and the government allowed this park to be reopened after the catastrophes of the past. With all that said I highly recommend you watch the movie. It's a great time.

To all you pple that rate this movie in the negatives can suck it aye fair enough your here to make opinions don't have to drop a load horse crap outta your mouths over it half the stuff you pple say is bull crap anyway pple say the story didn't make sense I mean come on are you that dumb to understand the story is brilliant professor John Hammond that Korean lad in that movie was the lad outta the first one who took on hammonds work to build that park hasn't got anything to do with the second jp nor the 3rd  jarrasic park... Loved every minute of it ... The haters!!

Jurassic World is not a bad film. It holds its against the original film we all know and remember. Saying that, it is not a perfect movie. The beginning of the movie really brought back that sense of wonderment that the first movie gave us years ago. I would say this is easily the second best movie in the series. I would recommend seeing the movie even if you are skeptical.

Jurassic World is an incredibly solid thriller. Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) and Owen (Chris Pratt) were well written, and the indominus rex was a very awesome dinosaur and was a fitting antagonist for the movie. The CGI was also very good but there was an over-reliance on it and they could have used animatronics in many places, but the CGI was still very good. If you are a fan of the originals, you should definitely check this one out. 8/10

Jurassic World is a worthy film in the JP series. Colin Trevorrow has done justice to the franchise, not as thrilling and suspenseful as the first, but better than The Lost World and Jurassic Park 3. The special effects are extremely well done, particularly the raptors and the new dinosaur. There are great references to the first film, which many die hard fans will like. Its great to see a large variety of dinosaurs in the film. Chris Pratt does a tremendous job as the leading man. Once the main action starts it does not stop, visually dazzling and brilliant action sequences!

If you walk into the theatre expecting to experience the equivalent to a fun Jurassic Park themed roller coaster at Universal Studios then you will enjoy the heck out of this movie. I felt like a kid again watching this! Though it doesn't have the same punch or as many awe-inspiring moments as the first Jurassic Park, this was a refreshing change of pace for the franchise. And even though The Lost World: Jurassic Park in my opinion is a very underrated film, Jurassic World is very worthy successor to the first movie and is a much needed improvement over the last two sequels, even The Lost World. I really enjoyed the fact that a lot of elements in the first movie make a comeback in this film. Chris Pratt's character is also the best the part of this movie and makes a lot of elements in this film that could have been super cheesy into cool and badass instead. My two major complaints though are that some of the supporting characters are not very well developed, and there are times where the movie gets very predictable. Other than that, have fun! It's a fun roller coaster ride with dinosaurs and is also the best Jurassic Park sequel to date.
DotCD's review of  Jurassic World

I really don't like how a lot of reviews online are comparing this move to the first film. Of course this film is not going to exceed the expectations of the first film! It just sucks to see that every review I read is bashing it on the characters or what they talk about, that is not what you see this movie for, you see it for it's thrills. This is a sad issue with a lot of movies these days, critics and some of the fanbase give the movie low scores because its not like the movie they remember. This is a sequel to a movie series we have not seen in 15 YEARS, cut the film some slack! Its a movie that exceeded my original assumptions and man i really dislike the critic reviews for a film that deserves way more credit.
I took my wife to see this film opening weekend, and I was not at all disappointed.

Great film and also great entry since 2001 making. Great performances from Chris Pratt. Thrills were okay dinosaurs... kinda look fake. but other than that its the second best in the series cant wait till number 2 in 2017.

I thought this movie was great! Not better than the first, Jurassic Park, but still stunning and beautiful to look at. I highly reccomened seeing this movie in IMAX if possible. The action scenes were really intense and the whole theatre shook. The visual effects were amazing a looked really clean and realistic you can tell the spent a lot of time detailing the dinosaurs. This movie kept me wanting more and made me want to visit the park myself. Also the easter eggs were amazing!

Jurassic World is colorful, eye popping and incredibly fun. Chris Pratt is good in the lead and Bryce Dallas Howard's character has much more to it. This movie is flat out BONKERS, sh*t flies in your face, the TREX eats everyone in his path, and cause sh*t to explode every minute to remind you, that you paid the 3D extra. Look, its not the best and not a masterpeice,  but for what it is, Director Colin Trevrorrow delivers us the same formula which made the older movies such golden hits, he excutes it with cheesiness, expolsions and a hint of terror and emotion. Jurrasic World puts to the table, John Hammond's vision of the Park redisgined, boy does it look spectacular. Isla Nubar is the Disneyland for kids of the generation. It was very cool to give it a theme park vibe and that surpasses the original theme park a million times. Technology has advanced and Jurassic Park has aged with grainy picture shots and laughable technology gizmos, but it worked. World features stuff that is attracting to our generation. I remember watching it on VHS and just loving every single moment, well acted and directed movie, Jurassic Park. Jurassic World is a fun movie, some pf the most fun I have had at the movies in a long time. But it goes over the top sometimes, and that is why it is so cheesy. But it clicks. Watch it in 3D. You will LOVE it.

There was something special with the Original Jurassic Park that sparked my interest in movies and dinosaurs. The something was very lacking about the two previous sequels Lost World and III, something this movie brings back somewhat. Basically being in a Theme Park setting for me does half the job of making this movie something special.

Jurassic world not only triumphs the original but expands and explores its current universe. The Jurassic era is back and swinging with both arms!.The movies full of fun and excitement exactly what the doctor ordered. A sequel cries mercy.

Jurassic World is a great movie. It seems people are never going to be happy with anything produced these days, that being said i believe they have done a good job with Jurassic World. It has a few nods to the original movie which i thought was great and throughout the movie it had funny moments and brutal moments. I think its definitely worth a watch.
Absolutely incredible, will be seeing again. Story turn after twist, it was very well done and the cast were fantastic. Sexist claims are completely redundant having watched the whole movie.

Arguably the worst Jurassic Park Film to date. Should be called "Product Park" due the the sheer volume of product placement within. Ridiculous and nonsensical plot only functions because the characters are all morons. CGI special effects are dated and overused. Characters are completely forgettable and one dimensional, I actually cant even remember one first name. Female lead is completely objectified running from dinos in high heels and unblemished makeup. Really Bad. Go see Mad Max.

I'm glad they took their time in making this film. Jurassic Park 3 was awful way to much humor. Jurassic World has some humor but nothing that ruins the seriousness of it. A different story line then expected with the raptors but you could tell with the trailers its going to be something original. This was a fun movie. Wish they would of shown more of the park attractions.

Don't listen to the critics, if you go into this movie just sit back and relax and just enjoy it. Don't look to deep into it. The action scenes beat the avengers and the characters are enjoyable. It is on tier with the original and it looks great. Minor plotholes aside, this movies action scenes (which is the majority) are AMAZING!

Everybody knows exactly what they're getting into with this movie, so no point in anybody complaining about it not being Oscar worthy. It's Jurassic Park reloaded, it follows the same design idea as the first flick, but in a good way. Chris brings the comedy and heroics, Bryce brings the surprisingly authentic awkward-but-likeable (and by no means helpless) support, and the other characters fit their rolls nicely (especially Jake Johnson), even if they are far from fleshed out or engaging. Dinosaurs will run amock, people will get hurt, CGI will get all up in your face. But when you sit back and take it for what it is, it's more than just enjoyable, it's a full on rollercoaster ride of Dino indulgence. Be warned, they like to get nice and cheesey at times!

A solid entry into the Jurassic Park franchise, while it doesn't quite reach the heights of the original. The direction, CGI, and thrills are on point here along with a fantastic and likable performance by Chris Pratt. Aside from Grady, Hoskins, Barry (played by Omar Sy), Cruthers and the return of Henry Wu; alot of the characters are a mixed bag. I found Claire to be a bit annoying and her nephews (especially the youngest) to be equally annoying. The film also suffers from alot of seemingly forced dialogue and not to mention a somewhat convenient plot. That being said, this movie triumphs over the disaster that was Jurassic Park 3 and is a enjoying, thrillride for most of the film.

Perfect family occassion, just sit down and relax :-) Visit Juraassic World, which was directed by Colin Treworrow, you will experience something new.I recommend it to everybody who likes dinosaurs, humour, action...

Jurassic World es una gran sorpresa, fue mejor de lo que pensé. Esta parte (continuación, no remake) hace justicia y respeta los toques clásicos de la cinta original. Me atrevo a decir que Jurassic World es la mejor secuela de la saga, no es mejor que la pelicula original (Jurassic Park de 1993 por Steven Spierlberg) pero sin duda alguna es mucho mejor que sus secuelas: The Lost World - Jurassic Park (1997) y Jurassic Park III (2001). En Jurassic World te espera una buena dosis de acción y suspenso, cargado de efectos especiales y buenas actuaciones (aunque el guion sea algo flojo) por eso y mas Jurassic World es una gran secuela, divertida y llena de suspenso, garantizando una gran experiencia para las nuevas generaciones y para los fanáticos de corazón.

Given how long it's been since we've last had a Jurassic Park movie this just wouldn't have been a good sequel without at least a few nods to the original. Thankfully this movie has them in spades. The music in particular is a real treat that will bring back some fond memories. That's not to say though that your enjoyment of this film will hinge upon how much nostalgia you have for the original. This is a sequel that manages to do it's own unique thing for the series while simultaneously reminding us why we fell in love with the 1993 hit.

Amazing two hour roller coaster ride, especially fantastic in IMAX 3D. You definitely get what you should expect, action, action and more action. Chris Pratt is hilarious, and the special effects are top notch.
I love the way they tied in aspects of the original Jurassic park. I was pleasantly surprised. I will go back to see it in 3-D. Bryce Dallas Howard star is really on the rise.

Jurassic Park fans, hold onto your butts!  Jurassic World is a thrill ride that will have you screaming even while you are covering your eyes.  There were so many scream worthy moments, I lost count.  Probably because I was busy screaming.  Chris Pratt is pretty darn cute as the hero raptor whisperer.  It sounds crazy, but apparently you can bond with a raptor.  Bryce Dallas Howard has the proverbial stick up her behind, but once things go south, she can man-up, even in those high heels she wears.  She is supposed to be bonding with her nephews, but has left them in the care of an underling.  Bad move, Claire!  Being boys, they promptly ditch the babysitter and set off on their own adventure.  Bad move, guys!  They end up in the thick of things and any bonding that takes place is between the brothers in peril.  Jurassic World is tons of fun and screams.
Jurassic Park is One of the best Movie Of this year and best sequel in the Franchise.The story was simple and GoodThe VFX were great.So many intense scenes.The humour was great.

Great movie if not as awe inspiring as the first, but I imagine that's to be expected. It was easily the best of the sequels. The cast was terrific with special emphasis on Chris Pratt.  It was a lot of fun. I-Rex was awesome.

From the moment the familiar theme music started Jurassic World grabbed you as it took you back in time 20 years to the classic Jurassic Park.  Was it as good as the original?  No not even close because back then we had never seen dinosaurs come back to life so realistically.  So basically coming in we knew what to expect as far as the story goes.  Kids sent to a relative in Jurassic World, this time an Aunt as opposed to Grandfather John Hammond.  Every precaution is taken to protect the guests but as we all know the guests are food for the nothing can go wrong dinosaur theme park.  Chris Pratt as the hero recreates the same character as in the blockbuster hit Guardian's Of The Galaxy, a modern day Harrison Ford if you will.  Whatever can go wrong does go wrong.  And Chris Pratt's character comes to the rescue for the kids and falls in love with the ice cold Aunt who happens to be the director of the park.  It's just a great popcorn flick for the entire family.  The special affects are absolutely outstanding.  Look for this movie to take in over $100 million dollars this opening weekend.  Fun movie everyone should enjoy as long as you know going in it's feeding time for the dinosaurs.
I'll try and keep this as short as I can. Jurassic World is a fantastic film, but you should go in with arms wide open, and try not to think too much of it's previous films. It's as simple as that.

Congratulations on setting records. It just goes to show that family friendly entertainment is where the money is.  I found it incredibly formulaic and predictable. With several laugh out loud moments for it's sheer stupidity. (I'd have to admit I was the only one in the theater laughing however)

Jurassic World is a great, idiotic barn-stormer of a movie. I don't remember the last time I had so much fun watching a cheesy effects driven flick. Dinosaurs munch people and each other, the kids aren't particularly annoying, Chris Pratt is cool and... Well... That climax... Pure awesome sauce. Jurassic World is simply a really fun ride!

It starts off rough, and it lacks the sense of awe that the original had, and the characters start off as shallow and uninteresting. Once Jurassic World gets going, it manages to be a fun Blockbuster with cool action sequences and exciting moments, but ultimately, the entire experience feels shallow and disappointing.

This is movie is just good entertainment. Period. It has some emotion, some action, some stupid moments which may not have been the best ever, overall they don't decrease the overal fun and wow factor of this movie. If you want to be entertained, go see this movie and just don't expect the best plot or acting ever.

I don't know if watching it in 3D ruined my "wide screen 'big' theater view", but it didn't really wow me. I liked the twist they put on things, but it felt under told and the ending fell short for me. It was QUITE predictable. One thing that bothered me was you never felt that... "Oh crap, a dinosaur is hunting me" feel. The whole point of enjoying multiple movies in a series, is enjoying that similar feel. I'm not saying that I want it to be exactly the same... but what made Jurassic Park movies so great was the, "Oh crap, a dinosaur is hunting me" feel. Because there was just chaos everywhere... and we kept getting thrown around the park without it building any suspense for certain situations. I really felt disappointed that I went and spent money on 3D movie tickets, popcorn and soda for me and family... Maybe that's because I download most movies and rarely go to the theater... and I expected my first theater visit in a while to really WOW me... but it didn't. I'm not saying it was horrible. I liked the twist, the effects, the action (even though i felt it was missing something in that department, just felt like wild chaos).... I still give it an 8. It WAS a good movie, just didn't live up to what I thought that it could have been.

Very good entertainment concerning the dinosaurs and the dinosaur's character's motives for doing what they're doing to humans. The stories about the humans were incomplete and did not seem to flow between scene to scene making it seem as though there were gaps of film left out. The filmmakers should have kept the focus on the dinosaurs and left out the human's incomplete stories; like Planet of the Apes does. Now THAT would be interesting!

Jurassic World is a sequel and a reboot of the series. It often mentions a few parts from the first two movies however its basically a new movie with sci-fi twist and some fantasy elements (with technology). For fans who were disappointed in the last movie will surely enjoy this movie as there is plenty of action/suspense between characters and the dinosaurs that appear. The movie also goes for nostalgia specifically during the ending which many fans will surely enjoy. Despite some of the acting not being on par with the first two movies - this is still a great movie for old and new fans to watch especially considering it has a huge future ahead.

It's setting records at the box office and is the most talked about film in years, Jurassic World, the thrilling true sequel to Jurassic Park. I loved Jurassic Park and felt that both sequels didn't do justice to the original, so when they announced that this film would go on the premise that the two sequels never happened, I was extremely excited. Like everyone else, I rushed to the theaters to see, the exact same film I saw twenty years earlier. The tech is better, the effects are better, but the story is almost identical, to the point where each character has an equivalent in the original film. In Jurassic Park, the T-Rex escapes while the kids are in a car, touring the park. In Jurassic World, the Adominus-Rex escapes while the kids are in a sphere, touring the park. This is just one example of literally dozens of parallels to the original film. The only real difference is Chris Pratt, as he is a hell of a lot more believable than Sam Neill was, and his infectious personality makes him the type of guy that everyone wants to be friends with. From his simple start on the WB's Everwood to becoming a Guardian of The Galaxy, Chris Pratt has established himself as one of Hollywood's brightest future stars, but aside from his performance, this is the same film! The Jurassic franchise has the benefit of being created by one of the greatest science fiction writers of all time. It is produced by perhaps the greatest Director of all time, and once again it introduces moviegoers to some amazing new special effects, but none of it matters when the story just isn't there. With this film people were hoping for something new and exciting from the franchise, a turn in a whole other direction, instead they got a film that is little more than a remake of the original, and a disappointing one at that.

I am on my vacation in Croatia, but cannot resist the temptation to visit a local multiplex  and watch this box-office record-shattering blockbuster, now has officially revitalised the JURASSIC PARK franchise, it brings back the nostalgic audience who has welcomed and impressed by the first tent-pole came out exactly 22 years ago with umpteen salutes, and competently revamps the visual spectacle to win over new audience. Director Colin Trevorrow and his team has accomplished a quite impressive job!

Jurassic World was a decent film till all hell broke loose and then stupidity set in. The science of genetically designing new species of dinosaurs - Indominus Rex - was pretty fascinating. I'd go so far as saying this film could've been a hit as a mockumentary. But instead, they have to play out the worst-case-scenario and that's when all the implausibility happens and everyone goes, "gimme a break", like when the two kids outrun I-Rex at first, and then every time after that. When leads Owen and Claire go all "Romancing the Stone" on us running through the jungle with no training and in street clothes, and when all the flying dinos get loose in the park mall, everyone's just running around in the open getting picked off one by one like Hitchcock's "The Birds" on steroids.  Then the final dino fight scene could've been superiorly epic but the director had to keep weaving the leads in which just added more and more stupid. The film's SFX were fabulous but forcing the integration of humans with them was this film's primary failing, as it is in so many other films. Recent films that stand out by getting this right include: Pacific Rim, Into the Storm, and Mad Max: Fury Road.
Jurassic World might not be a rule bending blockbuster, but it is still thoroughly entertaining. A great visual treat with a very likable cast. It is hard not to enjoy the movie.

"World" is not a good movie! It is an excellent good movie! I would have given it a "10" but some of the character development is a bit clumsy, but for the most part it does what a sequel should--it's even BETTER than the originals!!! I don't have to tell you that the Dino CGI is jaw dropping and add to that the production team has remained loyal to the original tenets of this franchise! -kids in danger-bad guys in danger-a woman warrior to fend off the impossible odds, but the production team has done what is the almost impossible task of creating new heart thumping situations based on the old story line. This is one movie where I came to the end and thought it was well worth the money I spent on admission for the 3D tix. I'm glad I ignored the naysayers and caught this exciting movie experience!!

While Jurassic World does not capture the amazement of the original, there is some blatant product placement, and some of the comedy in the film is quite dry, it is a wildly entertaining film and a (finally) worthy sequel to Jurassic Park. Pratt and Dallas-Howard are solid actors in this film and the rest of the human characters have emotions and development for once. The dinosaurs and the pure magic of the theme park are what really steal the show. Thanks to Trevarow's great direction, the park and the dinos are shown in amazing settings and even though they are CG, they look amazing. This film is definitely worth and I believe Jurassic Park fans are finally satisfied with a solid film.

Jurassic World, though not even stand close to the giant shoulders of it's progenitor, Jurassic Park, delivered in a way I had not expected it to. It successfully acknowledged the impact of the original film and I feel Director Colin Trevorrow understood that he would never be able to recapture that feeling of awe and wonder the original instilled in our hearts (the scene where the Brachiosaurus stands on it's two hind legs and grabs food from the tree springs to mind) and so instead chose to create a more modern installment to the Jurassic Park franchise.

I can't consider myself to be a fan of such kind of films, but I think that it is quite nice and enjoyable. The only thing missing is the interesting plot, but the dinosaurs and effects make it look really good.
It wastes talented actors and has ridiculous plot holes, but "Jurassic World" provides the most important thing an action-packed summer blockbuster needs to provide: entertainment!
Jurassic World is not a good movie. Don't read the next sentence unless you want the most general very general, premise of the movie. I wouldn't even call it a spoiler.

Jurassic World is the definition of a popcorn flick. Placed under any level of scrutiny, its quality as a film deteriorates rapidly. The plot is questionable and it does nothing not already seen in the original Jurassic Park. However, it really, really delivers in the entertainment category. Ultimately, film is supposed to be entertainment and this film entertains. It is a ton of fun for the whole family, provides numerous thrills and a ton of nervous excitement as the situation down in Costa Rica takes a turn for the worse due to the humans being stupid and selfish. The human drama placed into the film is idiotic and never really works on any level, but damn, there are a bunch of really cool dinosaurs that attack and eat people. The special effects are impeccable, Chris Pratt makes a case for being one of the strongest leading men right now with a decent acting performance that was best in the one category that matters, charisma. Jake Johnson was also great and a showstealer at times. The characters were pretty dumb, sure, but I don't know, I kinda dug Jurassic World. I feel dirty and hypocritical, but watching dinosaurs eat people is a ton of fun.

Colin Trevorrow's Jurassic World not only reinvigorates the franchise with a much needed breath after Jurassic Park 3, but successfully brings together a whole new audience combined with the original fans of the franchise in an action packed, heart-felt, thrill ride, which will leave you drooling for more dinosaur action.

Although some of Jon Hammond's magic ends up lost in this latest addition to the landmark Spielberg franchise, "Jurassic World's" likable character work and imaginative set-piece design carve a pretty solid space just below the original film's greatness.

It was pretty cool, but didn't really "wow" me the way I thought it would. I'm a huge Jurassic Park fan, and honestly I was expecting a bit more. Still, definitely worth a watch. And I can not remember one single character's name from the movie lol. After the movie my one friend was like "Can anyone here remember any of the character's names?" And out of the 4 people that watched it with me, pretty much no one could remember any of them. The Dinosaurs on the other hand....
It's sexist and stupid, but it's a lot of fun. The cast is charming and the CGI is spectacular. If you can "check your brain at the door," as they say, then you'll enjoy every giddy minute.

Not the best acting, not the best story, and not the best scripting, but the movie still does a pretty good job with everything else. It's obviously made to be one of those action-insane movies, without much depth at all. The actors weren't really that good (except for a few, like Pratt). I'll have to say that it was a decent watch though!

You know what you are getting with this movie before you even go see it, for the most part. (I saw it in 3d with a significant number of other people, but not at an IMAX, or other particularly impressive screen, and the sound setup was merely decent there. ) This is the kind of movie that is all about the spectacle, and has a very mediocre script. That said, the acting is actually pretty good, especially Chris Pratt, but including the others, which makes it all the more unfortunate they didn't spend a tiny portion of their budget to  make sure they could get a good script. I'm sure that for a few million they could have easily hired a few great writers to bang out a script that would have had it rise above this mediocrity.  Obviously they didn't need to, seeing its success, but I think it hurts the brand long term, as people tire of pure spectacle in the same universe.
Probablemente sea el blockbuster del verano ya que cumplió con su cometido de emocionarnos y disfrutar el parque de dinosaurios que nunca se debió de abrir.

Jurassic World proves to be a stronger film than the previous two entries, however this movie being the fourth movie in the franchise is where its weakness lies. Before the movie begins any person can ensure they already know what to expect. Dinosaurs will escape, people will get hurt and eventually it will lead to a predictable ending.
"Here's another movie about dinosaurs with the exact same story as the one movie you loved as a child; Jurassic World (Park). It even got Chris Pratt in it. Feed us with your money now"

This movie is about spoiled children and their parent's marital problems.  I am so disappointed that this movie wasted so much time dragging me through their drama only to eventually reach the third act and literally throw them in the back of a truck and forget about them.  When the dinosaurs actually do make appearances I was very impressed.  The story was ridiculous and unbelievable and I loved it.  The final few scenes would have scored a 20/10 and that is the only reason this can get a 7.  The first half (4/10), the second half (10/10).  I would say gut through the first half and you will be rewarded.
This movie was a great movie. I liked how it putt he first park into the story. The Dino's were great. The part that I really liked was that you could see the park become a real theme park.

A formidable action film, with a well thought out script for its respected genre. Despite some human performances and stunning visual effects, the imagination of Crichton's original novel has lost its vigor, the originality that gave the original novel and film its drive to become an thought-provoking story on how bringing back life can create death, and whether or not bringing back life is as good as we intend it to be. I still think this was more or less an action-thriller, and in that respect, it got it right on all marks.

This is a well-made, enjoyable film. The storyline is easy to follow, there's character development and there are some elements that go back to the first Jurassic Park. Sometimes what happens seems a bit cliché and I still don't get why the two main characters needed to start a relationship (another unneeded plot line) but overall these don't distract much. Not a must-see, but definitely good.

What I liked most about Jurassic World is that it didn't try to be the first movie. There are homages here and there, but it doesn't try to be the same movie. The effects are solid, the characters are pretty basic but very likable, and while it doesn't capture the "magic" of the first movie, it's still an entertaining ride. A solid sequel, and probably the first & only sequel to Jurassic Park I can recommend.

What's wrong with the critic reviews? What's wrong with you guys? This movie is bloody Aweeeeeesome!!!! The dinosaurs are damn real! We need more dinosaur movies! I used to watch walking with dinosaurs to satisfy my dinosaur movie needs! Damn, and there should be more dinosaur titled games! I played every dinosaur titled games in the market! Rate it up, so that more dinosaur movies will be made!

22 Years ago, a film was released that changed the way we make films, for good, 2 sequels followed that kinder polarised fans of the series even to this day, but can the newest entry in the series, Jurassic World, stand up to 1993's near perfect Jurassic Park? It can? Wow! Jurassic World is an absolute thrill ride from start to finish, with a great script, great performances, great music, great visuals, this is certainly a worthy entry to the Jurassic Park franchise. The Script is great, very tense but also very funny at points, although the focus is slightly cloudy at points I can overlook this, the performances by, yeah everyone are great, Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard give strong tense performances, Vincent D'Onofrio is great as the film's primary antagonist, Irrfan Khan and B.D Wong shine throughout the film, and even Jake M. Johnson and Judy Greer give stunning performances in their rather limiting roles, but I think it's Nick Robinson and Ty Simpkins who really shine here, their roles are simply the run away from the big dinosaur roles, but they turn them into something deeper and more interesting, this is without a doubt the best cast in Jurassic Park history (just a shame there's no Sam Neill). As for direction, it's great, Colin Trevorrow did a great job in recapturing the feeling of amazement of watching Jurassic Park for the first time, although personally I prefer Spielberg's direction in Jurassic Park and The Lost World, and even Johnston's direction in Jurassic Park III, but it's still first class direction. Summing up (finally), Jurassic World is a worthy addition to the franchise, hell I'd say it can compete with the 1993 original, but for me, that film will always reign supreme. Fast, Fun, and Epic, the cast and crew have really captured a certain type of awesome that hasn't been seen for about 22 years, nice one guys!

Jurassic World was very unoriginal. I give it a 7 mainly for its effects and efforts. Almost everyone in this movie sucks at acting (even with the likes of Gomer Pyle, Star Lord, and the older Pi Patel). We haven't been told the story enough times (almost the same story as Jurassic Park, only with a new type of dinosaur with a ridiculous name). Dialogue was all over the god damn place (many things were also out of place). Cliches. Deus ex machinas. The list goes on and on in all seriousness.

I was looking forward to this movie, as the trailers made it seem exciting to see, and I was not disappointed.  Chris Pratt (from Guardians of the Galaxy fame) is an actor I would like to see more of in action films.  The dinosaurs were great to see again, and the move even paid homage to the original movie.  And of course the theme song was always great to hear again!

"If something chases you, run"... well that was a pretty stupid thing to say to your child, especially when he's off to visit a wide park full of gigantic living creatures. Not that this line tears down the entire movie, but the dialogue is so mediocre in this movie it makes me wanna punch myself. Thankfully, that's not much of a problem, as this movie delivers stable performances from Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard and Vincent D'Onofrio (funny enough these guys already played different Marvel characters) and offers enough narrative thrills to entertain. I gotta say though, there are some dumb people in this film. The guy near the end who opened the van's door when the raptors were on the loose? Yeah, why the hell did he do that? Anyway, this is really a solid movie and I would recommend to anyone who's a fan of monster movies or Jurassic Park trilogy.

Keep in mind before you read this review that i have been a fan of all things Jurassic ever since the very first movie i love Jurassic Park and even enjoy the two sequels The lost world and Jurassic Park 3. I was anticipating this movie ever since it was announced. I waited in excitement for the trailers and even freaked out in excitement when the 30 second teaser was released. So when this movie was finally released i was one of the first people in line to see it. And for the most part i really enjoyed this movie the acting was good for the most part particularly by Chris Pratt and even the two younger siblings i thought did a good job. I thought that the love story was a little forced but to be honest it was such a small part of the actual movie it didn't matter to me. And the dinosaurs were awesome. The cgi has come such long way that they looked real. And it was amazing to see the park finally open in all its glory. Which brings us to a very important part of the movie. The Indominous Rex I thought that the Indominous Rex was awesome and added a new and interesting twist to the Jurassic Park franchise. Some people complained that they thought this was more of a monster movie than a Jurassic movie however i have to disagree i thing that this movie was a good ending note the the Jurassic franchise and i am glad that the position this movie holds no longer belongs to Jurassic Park 3
Great action movie that combines best things done before but not reaching the fist one, maybe the bad thing about this one in particular are the excessive cgi effects, specially with the raptors.

It's better than the third, but it make sense why I love this one, because it has the same adventure like the second The Lost World. Experience the new casts to make new story, they really nailed it. I love all the casts. The action from the characters and also the dinosaurs, really dream comes true. It's even better than Age of Ultron *I must say*. Why? the antagonist character has the same weakness plot, that really easily defeated. But, the way the whole movie gave a strong performance, really COOLER than Age of Ultron. It makes me think of LEGO MOVIE. #awww *Lego Movie should win the oscar, sorry, Baymax!*

The newest and long awaited entry into the Jurassic Park franchise has a lot of things going for it. Filled with WOW moments and callbacks to the 1993 Spielberg directed film (Dr. Wu is back, the night vision goggles, the same jeeps), as to say "move over JJ Abrams there is a new Spielbergian in town and he ain't Gareth Edwards !". This should be the sequel we've been waiting for right ? well that just depends on YOUR expectations. For me though personally the B-Movie story and the pseudo science behind the new (not really a) dinosaur is terribly ludicrous making Jurassic World another casualty to the phrase "Leave your brain at the door". But that doesn't mean it's not "fun" at least in some parts, Chris Pratt plays Raptor wrangler Owen Grady who (along with his raptors) acted as the glue that held this monster of a movie together since the other characters (with the exception of Masrani and Dr. Wu) were badly written. Even Bryce Dallas Howard couldn't make her part believable because her character was the typical "i'm a stuck up business person that tries to suppress my human emotions" then toward the end becomes "i'm no longer stuck up because my emotions were brought out by the plot happening and now i'm in love with Owen even though there was almost no buildup to the relationship". I will reluctantly give a pass to the child actors in this movie even if their reactions to some situations were questionable and the out of nowhere "our parents are getting divorced" conversation that didn't go anywhere was random like most of their dialogue. But we can't pay attention to that because obviously the 4 writers of this movie didn't because the kids were created so that the audience could go with them and see the attractions of  Jurassic World and that's a somewhat justification. The not too shabby 3D and the D-box seat I was in made the film more enjoyable amplifying the experience of it's strengths, the sound and the effects. Overall, It wasn't as great as the hype machine made it out but it's not as dreadful as the last 2 sequels making this movie a brass knuckled gut-puncher with the inscribed words "It's Alright" embedded into your stomach like so many summer blockbusters before it.

Jurassic World is one of the best theatre experiences I have ever had. I'm not going to say that this film is better than the original because there is so much material that is inspired by the first film. Many characters resemble the classic characters in the original film and there are several shout outs to the 1993 classic throughout the film. Chris Pratt said that this film was a film made by a Jurassic Park fan for Jurassic Park fans and that could not be anymore true. The dinosaurs look great, and the action is so outstanding that I had my popcorn finished before the movie was halfway done. Chris Pratt offers a bit more star power than this franchise is used to and he proves that 2014 was not a fluke for him. He does not show the level of humour that he had in Guardians of the Galaxy but he is still very funny and he grabs your attention in his scenes. Bryce Dallas Howard was also amazing and I really enjoyed her performance. There are also great supporting cast characters like Vincent D'Onofrio and the comedic relief Jake Johnson. What prevents a perfect score for me is the overuse of the original films magic and I found that the two young boys in the film take up a little too much of the screen time and although by the ending you can tolerate them, they are kind of irritating for the first few minutes. If you get an opportunity to see Jurassic World in theatres take advantage of it because it could be the blockbuster of the summer.

This is the best installment of the franchise since the original. It doesn't cover any new ground, but fans of the monster-movie genre should find more than enough to enjoy. Pratt and Howard are decent leads, and the effects have come a long way since 1993. Still no feathers, though.

Jurassic Park may have been the movie 65 million years in the making, but Jurassic World is the sequel 22 years in the making, because this is THE true sequel to the original. This movie takes everything you loved with the original, and modernizes it, re-introducing it to a new generation of kids who may have never witnessed the originals. While I don't like that every dinosaur in the film is CGI, which makes the movie lose the magic that the original trilogy had, It still has a great cast with a solid story and action scenes that will leave you with a grin on your face as you walk out of the theater.
Despite thin characters and a familiar plot, Jurassic World delivers plenty of escapist summer blockbuster entertainment with it's dinosaur mayhem and tense action scenes.

The sequel that should have been the third installment is still a major retread but a much bigger and better one than that last one was.  While of course the VFX are killer, so unfortunately is much of the dialogue.  While some is necessary, too much silly expositional dialogue which all these huge Hollywood blockbusters have nowadays more than ever really detracts from any seriousness and suspension of disbelief.  The basic story is sound with some interesting implications in an over-arching subplot which foreshadows future directions for the franchise.  The main problem is the execution while certainly proficient technically, it's ultimately lacking in boldness and real creativity.
It took me a while to finally sum up my feelings about Jurassic World:  SILLY.
This movie is a great movie that is a must-watch for anyone that is a fan of watching movies. With good acting, great CGI and lots of action. That is all I have to say.

What Jurassic World lacks in character development and plot; it makes up for just by being fun. I didn't care if the two brothers bonded or if the Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard characters got together. What makes this the best of the sequels; is the fact that it finally offered some cool ideas to the franchise.
Jurassic World is obviously not as good as the original , but still remains a well-acted, visual feast as well as a fun addition and the best sequel to the franchise.
"Jurassic World" 10 Scale Rating: 7.0 (Good) ...

gotta say i have never been a huge fan of jurassic park but this was an exception it was a good movie filled with the fun excitement and joy u expect from a summer movie i say go rent it its fantastic one of the biggest and best adventures this year

This was an enjoyable movie, although simple, predictable and very similar to the original Jurassic Park. Just this time instead of trying to engineer dinosaurs for science, it's for a tourist attraction. The acting and comedy were okay, but not great. This was very predictable, as it was the average corporation gets greedy, and things go awry, with somebody "evil" who wants to do something "bad" to the main object, then everything is solved and people learned their lesson. Perfect for money, but everyone knows most of those movies suck. I think this movie deserved a 7, but nothing better.
It doesn't capture the magic of the original, but Jurassic World is a fun movie with some exciting action, beautiful cinematography, and an excellent score.

Yes this a remake and No they are never the original, but still gave it a 9 for the sheer fun of it and for the fast ride the movie gives.  Does it feel re-done and similar yes some of it, but you have to figure they re-visit the island so that figures in, along with some of the original sets from the original movie, that coupled with the same dinosaurs except for a couple new ones.  Fast Forward though to new characters who are fun and vivid, and that coupled with non-stop action and cling to your seat kind of fun it still is pure enjoyment and fun to me!!  So not the the original's 10 score, but for me really damn close to it.  Go into the movie with your eyes open and ready for some hold onto your seat fun and you will be fine!!

Jurassic World makes a valiant effort to capture the feelings of the original, and for the most part it succeeds. I enjoyed it the whole way through, and while the side characters really deserved more screen time and there were some dumb/predictable moments, overall I think it's a great movie to watch with your brain turned off and popcorn in your hands.

This movie was... Well, great. There may be a lot of references to the first movie, yeah, but it's one of the best titles of the Jurassic Park series. It didn't instill the fear in us as much as the first one did, but I honestly don't think it was going for that. I don't really have much to say about it. Though, I must mention before I go any further, there were a few plot points that seemed important that weren't touched upon later in the film that were in the beginning, and it did have quite a bit of movie cliches, but I can forgive it. The plot was interesting, the characters were pretty likable, and, among all of the movies I've seen that have come out this year, this one probably takes the cake as the best one, and the second best Jurassic Park movie. And, mind you, this is coming from someone who has seen the entire series. Overall, it's one of those movies where you loved it, but you don't really understand why. Also, when they made references, I was either like, "OMH I REMEMBER THIS YAY", or "MEMORIES YAAAY". So yeah. Watch it. If you're a fan of the series, you'll like it a lot.

'Jurassic World' relies on nostalgia familiar cliches that we've seen in many action films and there is an absence on further character development, but it's hard to stay mad at the talented cast and the stunning special effects that do make the movie entertaining for the most part.
