Spectacular special effects. Definitely recommend watching the 3D version. Storyline was basic and some character roles were stronger than others. Not a plot driven flick.  Dismissing some of the carny dialogue & romantic scenes  ... movie was entertaining based on effects alone. Worth the money ... go see it if action is your thing
I'll be honest, Im a big Chris Pratt fan and although this movie put him more and more in the spotlight, the movie itself did not stand out.

A great movie! Very fun and exciting, funny comic relief and a good call back to the previous jurrasic park. Please don't read the reviews before seeing It, go and form your own opinion. The reviews tend to be hyper cynical of the movie

em 1993, steven spielberg nos apresentou uma obra de arte  chamanda jurassic park, esse filme revolucionou os efeitos especiais do cinema, se você assiste hoje em dia, os efeitos ainda estão honestos, depois tivemos as continuações que foram bem fracas, depois foi anunciado que essa franquia iria voltar, e ela voltou com tudo, com um roteiro simples, nada de muitos firulas o filme é rapido e se mostra como um belo blockbuster, chris pratt esta muito bom no papel de owen, chris tem um carisma íncrivel, e tem uma boa química com bryce dallas howard como claire, os meninos do filme, fazem com que a plateia se identifique com oa garotos, o final do filme é simplesmente íncrivel, por favor assista esse filme em imax, está muito bom. 10/10.

I once said that I didn't think the script would be very convincing. They open up a park and repeat the same mistakes. I'll just put that thought in a little box and put it away. Despite that criticism, the film is great! The script was so and some of the acting could have been more credible, but the real stars of this film are the dinosaurs, especially the raptors. I fell in love with them and hated to see them die. They were the heart of the film. I take solace in knowing that at least the beta survives. Behind the raptors, the Indominus and T-Rex steal the screen. This is a film I greatly recommend for any dino-lover. We don't get very many dinosaur films and this one is a great one to watch.

Let's be honest here, is this movie dumb? Yes. Does this movie makes any sense whatsoever? Absolutely not. Is this movie nearly as good as 1 and 2? Nope. But is this movie fun? Absolutely yes. It is just a big bag of fun, excitement, wonder and nostalgia, with great effects, cool action sequences and really good leads. This movie gets a lot of hate because it is not like the first two ones and it doesn't have the same magical and mystical spirit, but I think it is worthy of the Jurassic name because, as the first two ones, the main point is having a great time and enjoy an adventure film. On that point it perfectly delivers.

Twenty-two years after the events of Jurassic Park, Isla Nublar now features a fully functioning dinosaur theme park, Jurassic World. After 10 years of operation, a new hybrid is created to re-spark visitors' interest, which backfires horribly.

Jurassic World might not be as good as the Jurassic Park but it still deliver fun and entertainment. I gotta say this man. The first half of the movie is a complete **** Yes I am harshly saying this. **** Second half of the movie is awesome. Awesome! So in the end, I will say Jurassic World is fun pop-corn movie. I had so much fun in the second half of the movie.

A pretty mindless, very predictable and at times silly story.... but nonetheless fun to watch. If you were a kid when the original came out (I was 12 years old) then you'll enjoy this movie all the more.

Jurassic World is not the first film, however , the re-branding of the franchise into the twenty first century was done well. One of the biggest and most enjoyable aspect is the use of the velociraptor, they were a perfect supporting element to the main predator. It is also entertaining to see Chris Pratt riding around in a motorcycle alongside raptors dressed like Indiana Jones minus the hat and whip. Surely, the CGI is amazing , the sound effects were somewhat of an after thought. Fortunately, most of the match on action sequences make up for it. If your looking for a fun action film involving large prehistorical animals, this is a "must see " film.

A film that is not bad but not great either. Characters are fun but not relatable, you never feel emotion towards them, they just seem to be catalysts that keep the story moving forward, the acting was good but the writing let them down. CGI was a mixed bag, sometimes spectacular but sometimes clearly computer generated. The action is great and hardly ever stops, but due to the lack of character development and predictable moments you never truly feel fear. Dinosaurs in this film also seem more like monsters, unlike the first film where they are treated like 'wild animals'. Overall its okay, not the fantastic blockbuster we expected but still worth a watch, just don't expect it to be the prime film of the series.

One man's opinion - in some ways it's better than the original. Highly entertaining. Good pacing - not afraid to slow down for moments, but as the film progressed, action scenes increased in frequency. Considering it was the fourth movie featuring dinosaurs, it still maintained the wonder of these great creatures. It was a monster movie in the sense that many people got chomped or stepped on or knocked into trees. Nice touch of growing romance btwn main characters. The brothers seemed like realistic teens. There were a few dislikable characters to root against. And yes there were several visual references to the first 3 movies. Enjoyed it more than I thought I would. One man's opinion.

In my opinion it was quite an interesting movie, especially if you liked Jurassic Park's first parts. I liked Chris Pratt in the lead role and all the visuals were quite magnificient too. Of course you don't get the feelings you did when watching the original but this is still pretty good movie.

This movie had great special effects, great visuals and an intriguing storyline. The dialogue was a bit cliche and the movie might have been a bit too long, but was still an exciting ride from beginning to end. I would definitely encourage watching this in Imax or Imax 3d to experience this interesting world even more vividly. Fantastic summer block buster, a sequel is needed.

In a world where action / sci-fi blockbusters sometimes feel half an hour too long comes a sleek, well-paced (for the most part) Summer special effects romp. If you enjoy said Summertime spectacles, you'll love Jurassic World, the Jurassic Park sequel we've been wanting for over two decades. If you enjoy deeply complex plots, political commentary, or lofty character driven historical dramas then you'll pick apart everything about this movie that doesn't compare with "Citizen Kane" or "The King's Speech" (both of which I also happen to like. Heaven forbid people embrace numerous film genres.) The characters are likeable (as always for Chris Pratt), the plot is pretty straight forward, the special effects are great, the music is moving, and apart from the relatively slower intro (it's probably just under half an hour until we see an actual full shot of a dinosaur) the last hour and a half keep you enjoyably entertained. The last 20 minutes alone are, for lack more flowery language, very cool!

This movie was really great. Not as good as the first one, but the moment I heard the original Jurassic Park theme I was overwhelmed of nostalgia. And the last 15 minutes of this movie is silly, but so awesome! This movie still had it's cheesy and stupid moments. Also, there was a bit too much advertisement for products and company names like Mercedes and Imax. Still, the movie was a blast to watch, although I doubt that it will be a movie that I will be able to watch several times. All the homages, references, awesome classic dinosaurs, Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard's acting and the cool new Indominus Rex compensates brilliantly for the bad jokes and hilariously bad acting that there was from time to time. I definitely would reccomend this to any fan of Jurassic Park. You will certainly be stunned by nostalgia. I even teared up a bit when the legendary theme played. Check it out!

The introduction to this blockbuster was not what I expected. The first act of the film is kinda boring. I know when the movie start, there should be some introduction, some talking to introduce the characters and the park, but all those talking are unnecessary. It's like listening to scientist teaching us biology kind of boring.  Lots of uninteresting talk especially about 'in-gen'. To be honest, it's kinda boring. The characters are undeveloped.

Jurassic World could be said as one of the best films this year. Although the special effects were spectacular, the cheesiness and the fact its plot was very similar to the original took down two points for me. Nothing can beat the original film as it was such a big and new idea that had never been done before, unlike now since Jurassic Park first aired there has been many films about dinosaurs good and bad.

Jurassic Park was a great film, a so is this new adventure! Now the park is actually open to the public, and is presented to the public, like an actual amusemet park! There's tons of action, and some pretty good haracters, as well as a subtle satirical and comedic element to it.

My wife and I went to see this film today, and we both thoroughly enjoyed it.  There is plenty of action scenes in it, and there are also a few comedic elements in there too, but they are subtle, and not out of line.  It goes without saying that this is the kind of film that will keep you on the edge of your seat.  It starts off a little slow, but it quickly picks up the pace.  I thought it was just going to be a copy of Jurassic Park, but it wasn't.

Jurassic Park is one of the greatest movies ever made. Lots of people have mixed feelings for The Lost World, and Jurassic Park 3 is just plain bad. This movie actually has spirit, and it doesn’t try to top the 1993 classic.

You know, I admit I was skeptical before going to see this movie, simply because of the fact that the previous sequels were terrible. But I was pleasantly surprised. Better plot, better acting, better direction. The characters were believable, the kids were as likeable as Lex and Timmy were in the original. It is what you expect from Steven Spielberg. I was wondering if they were going to include a cameo by any of the characters from the original, and they did, although it was a minor character. Remember the smug Asian scientist in the lab in the first one, who said, "Are you implying that a group composed entirely of females will...breed?" He is in this one also, 22 years older, still working in the lab. Lots of references to the original movie that felt nostalgic. I also noticed that some scenes must have been filmed at Universal Studios (This was a Universal movie) - we just returned from vacation during Spring Break where we visited Universal Studios, and we immediately recognized the long, steep escalator that takes you from the lower level where the JP ride is, to the upper level where the rest of the park is.

A marvelous experience in which I had my heart beating so fast ! An amazing plot and an exceptional performance from Chris Pratt. It definitely cannot be compared to the first movie, but it exceeds the expectations. I personally recommend the public to watch it on 3D.

This is honestly the best movie I have ever seen! And I am a big fan of the other JP movies! Chris Pratt was awesome and so was the rest of the cast. But that aside it was extremely entertaining. Although, it is probably not suitable for younger audiences. I am 14 years of age and did not find it at all disturbing. It did not show anyone get eaten but did show blood. Overall this is a truly terrific movie that does the original Jurassic park proud.
2nd best Jurassic park or world  film but there are problems in the film like the divorce sub pilot is just 1 minute then it's over little stuff like that.

To be fair, this movie exceeded my expectations. I was expecting a bad movie. Was it bad? no. was it good? no. I'd say it was Okay. Chris Pratt and Ty Simpkins carries this movie. Those two are fantastic and are the spotlight of this film.

I had a lot of hope in myself for Jurassic World, I really did, it only delivered half of what I was expecting from it. The cast of this film was pulling their entire weight and succeeded only by the great role Chris Pratt had performed. The film seemed a little bit away from being a worthy reboot, but if the film tried to be something new and original at the same time I would talk more about.

Jurassic World is terrific!!  Best movie I've seen this year, and definitely belongs in our Jurassic Park series. Loved actually being able to see the "park" up and operating. Graceful, thrilling, popcorn filled fun, it's Jurassic World after all! This fourth instalment in the series is another engaging sequel and another dazzling popcorn thriller. From park to world, what are they going to think of next? "Jurassic Space" where aliens invade Earth and the humans and dinosaurs must learn how to communicate and cooperate with each other to save the planet? Now that's interesting. Jurassic World is a monster! it has a overall theme of "let's remember the old movies". Yes it does that, but also creates new moments only this series can give you with dinosaurs. It's great, Indominis is great, Chris Pratt is great. All the action is great. All the characters are just awesome. Especially Mososarus. That's the coolest dinosaur. I mean who dose not like a crocodile with Finns that can kill t-rex  hybrids.

It has been 22 years since the first Jurassic Park was made and now Spielberg has returned to create the new sequel Jurassic World. This time around Spielberg was not only faced with the task of making this one better than the last but it also had to be good enough to draw attention away from the previous two movies and help the audience mend the mental scars that they had left behind.

This is a remake of Jurassic Park so you know what to expect, dinosaurs running amok, bad guys with ulterior motives, kids that need to be rescued, the hero saving the day.  If you are not in the mood for this type of movie, see something else.  If you are looking for an action adventure thriller with "real" dinosaurs, this is it.

As a fan of the first one and only the first one, I see this movie as an "let's just move on" type. The characters in 'Jurassic World' aren't anything new and I'm talking about the kids in particular. I found these two mysterious kids as a left over that I don't even think I'll remember them, although it's confirmed that there will be another one. Chris Pratt felt kinda flat and to me he was really boring character, which I don't consider him a badass in my awesome mind. And Bryce Dallas Howard gives nothing special throughout the whole film. Now let's just move on to the action sequences. It gives it all, and it's more violent than the last three films which it did a great job in that. And the last fight, it felt real and gives you the suspense face. I'm just going to leave this review here and hopefully it doesn't cause hate.

It's good fun i guess but not as good as the first one. I just think they want money so they make a half ass story where these idiots make a new dinosaur, what can go wrong? Pretty stupid at times and some of the characters are annoying, but overall an okay movie with good visuals.

I went into this movie with pretty low expectations, but as a diehard Jurassic Park fan, I felt it was my obligation to make sure this movie is seen. In short, it completely blew me away with a perfect balance of nostalgia and freshness, a great cast, and, of course, the dinosaurs. Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard do a great job as the main characters, the main dinosaur is pretty cool, and the velociraptors, as always, are freakin' badass. If you are a fan of Jurassic Park, this is a must-watch. Even if you're not, it's still worth the money.

Entertaining popcorn escapism, That's what "Jurassic World" is. Nothing more, nothing less. If you expect to be blown away like you were when you first saw "Jurassic Park", forget it. This movie was made to take us away from the real world for a couple of hours, and to enhance the pocketbooks of all the folks who were involved in its making. The movie did not have a good plot, but of course, this is the Jurassic World, so the plot doesn't matter as much as dinosaurs do, and the movie had plenty of dinosaur action. It gave people what they wanted, and the acting in the movie was generally quite good as well. It gave a totally new feel to the Jurassic Park/World series.

It has been 22 years since Jurassic Park ushered in the modern age of computer generated imagery, becoming the first motion picture to use the then-cutting edge special effects technology to astound and amaze us. Director Steven Spielberg allowed us to believe that dinosaurs were real. Repetition made the second Jurassic Park installment, 1997's The Lost World, a step down and Universal's decision to cut the budget for the third movie, 2001's Jurassic Park III, seemingly put an end to the saga. However, after a 14-year gap, the T-Rexes, velociraptors, and their ilk are back. With Spielberg executive producing and Colin Trevorrow behind the lens, it's time to again return to a universe where amber-encased prehistoric mosquitoes have made it possible for extinct creatures to roam.

Jurassic world is another sequel to a film made in the 90's. Firstly, the special effects and dinosaurs in this film are believable and the actual Jurassic world park is really cool too. I like the nods to the original and the acting in general was pretty good. The characters are likable, especially those guys in the control room. However like all Jurassic park sequels it doesn't live up to the original. I think the last scene was a bit cheesy and was just there to please fan boys of the t-rex. It also builds up all this hype for dinosaurs and we hardly get to see any. The Jurassic world scene annoyed me slightly as the camera just pans across buildings and not dinosaurs. And all the plot holes....  sigh. In the end though Jurassic world is an enjoyable movie and while it isn't the best film ever, it is definitely the best of the Jurassic park sequels.

Truly a masterpiece of a film. I watched it over 100 times since I got the DVD (I might be exaggerating). Chris Pratt is amazing, as is Bryce Dallas Howard. Great effects. Dinos look so real. You really have to watch Jurassic World by putting all your sense of realism in your back pocket and not think too much about it.  There are so many implausibilities you finally come to the conclusion the filmmakers were trying to make a good "B" film.  At one point a boy jumps in a lake, then a few minutes later his brother asks him "do you still have those matches", and the boy takes out a matchbox, which would have gotten soaking wet and ruined, but they are somehow perfectly dry.  Then these two young boys get a jeep started and running perfectly that has been sitting for 20 years.  I don't know how they could put air in the tires, much less start the engine.  Dinosaurs actually talk to each other in this film.  I could go on and on as many people have done.  In the end I was entertained enough to make it to the end, but because it is simply a rehash of the original I can't give it a very high rating.

Forgetting that the second two films ever existed, Jurassic World takes up the story with the park well and truly open and disaster just around the corner. The park is brilliantly realised and the new genetically engineered dinosaur adds new terror (not that it was strictly necessary) Chris Pratt proves that Guardians Of The Galaxy was no fluke and that he has real star quality, while Bryce Dallas Howard handles running in heels with aplomb. The film works because it understands what made the first film such a success and simply builds on it, tipping its hat to the original subtlety along the way. A great, old fashioned crowd pleaser.

While I'm not a gigantic fan by any means, I gotta give it up to the original "Jurassic Park" film, because it's excellent. And to be honest, "Jurassic World" wasn't on my radar at all, I kinda wanted to see it just to weigh in on all the hype and box-office records. And all things considered, the film was good, just nothing excellent. It's nowhere near as impactful or revolutionary as the first film, but on it's own, it's a visually stunning, considerably exciting, solidly-acted film. It's not for everyone, and the huge box office numbers might cause a bit of hype backlash, but otherwise, "Jurassic World" is a pretty good animated film that's worth at least one watch.

Though this film promised to bring fresh life back to the series, its 'meh' factor remains quite strong. The cheesy dialogue and 'ok' special effects do not help, however there are a few new good ideas as well insights into new and old character development. This is enough to keep the film mildly entertaining.

In all honesty, I've never really cared for any of the previous three films, so I went into this one with an open mind and not too high of expectations. Basically, it was just a dumb, fun way to waste two hours. Chris Pratt, hot off the success of Guardians of the Galaxy did pretty well. Everyone else was just ok. The best parts were the action sequences and effects, which were quite impressive, if not a little too chaotic and over the top at times. Overall, like I said before, it was entertaining enough to get me through, but since I wasn't a huge fan of the other three films to begin with, I simply enjoyed this film and nothing more than that.

Well,the movie was a little bit disappointing.The graphics were amazing and Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard were pretty good but the movie was a little bit boring and there was some huge plot holes.

An awesome and funny blockbuster, that doesn't take itself too seriously, and doesn't fail to entertain its audience. I was really satisfied with this movie, and the references to the old classic just made the whole experience better.

Jurassic World is the first Jurassic movie in 14 years and sadly doesn't hold up to the first Jurassic Park. The whole movie feels like slightly wasted potential, most parts are some what entertaining but consistent slow scenes and bad writing really take away from the enjoyment of the film. Multiple times I found myself doubting or laughing at somewhat serious scenes because of how out of place or bad some scenes felt. The special effects themselves looked good and most times it felt like they represented the dinosaurs accordingly but sadly it feels like most of the movie takes place in a studio full of green screens with hardly any on location filming. Acting from the Movies main star Chris Pratt is quite good as usual, Chris himself dose fall into that generic action hero role and doesn't stand out in this role as much as his others. Everyone else kind of just blends together and wont make much of an impression on you. The most enjoyable part of this movie is obviously just watching Dinos fight each other and kill people, witch is at some points is very bloody and gorey witch is nice to see they didn't try to hide the violence. All together Jurassic Park is a fun Week end movie to see with some friends but don't expect  Mad Max Level Action or get your hopes to up.

Finally, we get a Jurassic Park sequel that isn't completely idiotic and mind-numbingly boring. Jurassic World ignores the events of The Lost World and Jurassic Part III and introduces a new theme park 22 years after the first park closed where dinosaurs roam free, although it's more similar to something similar to Disney World than the original park. In order to spike attendance again, the park has created a new, bigger and scarier hybrid dinosaur, the Idominus rex, but the big guy escapes his enclosure, and it becomes a hunt for the dino before it makes its way to the resort. Jurassic World does take its time until the action really begins. The first act is completely dedicated to showing the park in its normal operational design, and while it is slow, it does try to capture the sense of wonder that the original Jurassic Park had. The dinosaurs in Jurassic World do look fantastic. It's great to just be able to marvel at them for the first 30 minutes. But this is a Jurassic Park movie; we want to see some dinosaur action. Luckily, the movie knows that point when to crank up the action, and it's actually quite jarring. It goes zero to a hundred really quickly. One moment I was watching the dinosaurs, a bit bored by this point, and the next I'm bracing my seat because of the sheer intensity of the film. Jurassic World is a seriously violent and visceral film. It's probably one of the most violent PG-13 movies I've seen since The Dark Knight, but the violence is about on par with the other three films, so you should know what to expect. The slow opening act makes the rest of the movie extremely effective and thrilling, and while Jurassic World didn't have anything as terrifying as the kitchen scene in the original film, there are plenty of scenes that will melt your face off. If you have the chance, go see it in IMAX 3D. It's definitely a movie you need to be completely immersed in to get the full effect. If you're a fan of the original Jurassic Park or you like newer monster movies like Cloverfield and Godzilla, Jurassic World is the movie to see this summer.

Jurassic World is directed by Colin Treverrow (Saftey not Guarennted) and is the 4th Installment of the JP franchise. To start things off the effects of Jurassic World are really good and the performences were good, Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard and Vincent D'Niofrio (I definitely didnt spell that right) but my main problem is that Vincent D'Niofrio character is so over the top cartoonish that it got to the point where I was hoping he was going to die. The movie was a bit predictable at times and the movie is only 2 hours and 4 minutes but so much happens that movie feels 20 minutes longer than it actually is. The begining was really cool where the doors swing open and it's like Christmas came early. The kids didnt annoy me as much as I thought they would. The ending fight was a great part, better than the 20 second fight in Jurassic Park 3. The Indominus Rex was a really good feature and Mossarasus Dinosaur got a really cool kill on a very minor character. My main problem is the dialouge sometimes isn't the greatest and the comic relief didnt always hit. If they do another sequel like there planning on doing I hope they do get another directer, Colin Treverrow did do a good job but I ended up getting to hyped up and I was disappointed but the movie was enjoyable for what it was, A Jurassic Park movie where the main dinosaur antagonist is a monster not an actual dinosaur.

It's strange. As I was sitting in the bus on my home the plot deficiencies started coming to me. I could not put my finger on it, but something seemed to escape me. Storywise there was nothing in Jurassic World to elevate above the usual action flicks, no unique plot to really make it stand out. Looking back I started to feel empty. And yet as I was sitting in the cinema none of that really bothered me. These feelings came only later but as I was watching the film I felt completely satisfied. As far as action movies go I would easily put it amidst the best of the year.
Clearly the best film i've seen this year in theaters (Holy **** i've seen so many bad films this year, like Avengers 2), Jurassic World it's a thrilling film.

I've been waiting for almost 13 years for this movie. According to my parents, "Jurassic Park" is the first picture I've ever watched in my life. It's thanks to "Jurassic Park" that I want to study and work on the cinema business. For several years I've heard rumours about a "Jurassic Park 4", but it never got life. Until, in the end of 2014, I watched the trailer of "Jurassic World" for the first time. I thought: "This better not be like 'Jurassic Park 3.'". As it turns out, it wasn't. "Jurassic World" did what the previous "The Lost World" and "Jurassic Park 3" didn't. The movie does not bring previous characters, only new ones. Finally, they won't be put on the same situation, on the same island again. Although some flops from acting, several plot holes, this is still a good time-watching.

The same old story about a dangerous dinosaur that escapes from its cage (in a stupid way) and kills everything in its sight, besides a cool hero, a disgusting villain that gets a painful death, very smart kids and terrifying attacks. On the other hand, this is everything fans asked for, with incredible special effects and electrifying sequences. We even have a bit of an interesting relationship between animals and people! Anyway, the same recipe but still very delicious.

Jurassic World is a great action movie with a good story and great actors. The story is good and creative, as a good continuation of the old movies; the story will surprise in some parts. The actors and actresses are great, especially Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard. the visual effects are well done and the soundtrack is excellent. The biggest problem with this film is the hybrid dinosaur, he did not need to be there could be any classic dinosaur, besides that this invented dinosaur is almost a supervillain with superpowers. Overall, this movie is a great movie, with its only problem being the hybrid dinosaur. 7.5 / 10

I thought this films was fantastic! I was a little nervous at first but I thought they created a unique story and it wasn't the same old stuff and they added something new to the story. I thought they had a great cast and managed to add humor, romance, action, and adventure to it that they other films lacked. I know a lot of people criticize the films for completely changing the story but that was what I liked about it.

Though the movie shares the same lack of ability along with the other previous sequels to outmatch the original by Steven Spielberg, the film is still thoroughly entertaining to at least a little higher degree, yet it has its emotional moments the film could have been improved with a better script.

This movie is an excellent restart to "Jurassic Park" saga. It references the other movies while staying on the track of it's own story. Plus it is able to remain cheesy while having some decent action. The only problem I have is the big question of why would you make a dinosaur that could think and kill for sport? I mean their is just no reason for this killer to exist. but other than that the movie is all together entertaining. In conclusion this film is decent addition to this great franchise.
Wenn man sich den Film einmal genau angesehen hat dann hat er sehr viel mit dem ersten Teil der Reihe gemein.

With a great combination of nostalgic and original elements, Jurassic World presents audiences with the best sequel to Steven Spielberg’s original yet. The movie is fun and inventive, whilst taking on an exciting narrative arc combined with exciting characters and, most importantly, a fantastic array of dinosaurs. Whilst the film suffers from several plot inconsistencies and dialogue problems, it successfully takes the audience back to a world full of dinosaurs in an original yet nostalgic way. The re-imagining of what a park full of dinosaurs would look like if it were to exist in the future is portrayed with great originality. It also hints back at Jurassic Park throughout, particularly in a beautiful scene mid way through the film. Overall, Jurassic World is a fun movie that succeeds in taking viewers back to Steven Spielberg’s dinosaur fantasy.

this movie was super fun, obviously it wasn't going to be as good as the first because the first one totally changed cinema. chris pratt was awesome, the kid's subplot was kinda forced but i saw past it, and jake johnson's character was hilarious.

This movie is a great production, maybe the best of the year, it was funny moments, chaos, stress, and a new relationship with the dinosaurs, jurassic park 3 is the worst movie of all, but maybe the only thing salvageable of that it's the spinosaurus in my opinion.

Loved Chris Pratt in this movie and I enjoyed the movie overall. However, Bryce Dallas was very annoying and unappealing in this movie. For half of the movie while she is being chased and tossed around by killer dinosaurs, her hair stays perfectly blow-dried and styled as she minces around in stiletto high heel shoes. And then by the end of the movie we're supposed to believe that's she's somehow transformed into a Sigourney Weaver type of heroine who brandishes a military gun as well as a marine?

It's not the best of the franchise, far from it, but it is easily the best of the sequels by a long shot. The visuals are sharp, the acting is tolerable (for the most part), and the park itself looks spectacular. While it would've been nice to see more animatronics used in the film, the CG is convincing enough to look past that fact. As a whole, it is a worthy sequel to the original, although it lacks some of the heart and the overall feeling of awe and wonder.
Short review, but this film was really enjoyable with a good pace. Chris Pratt is awesome as the lead always makes me laugh!

Trust me, you have NO idea how good it felt to be scared sh*tless by dinosaurs again. I absolutely loved the first Jurassic Park. It was clever, action packed and pretty revolutionary for the time that it came out. The two that came after... well... the first one was watchable, and I did kind of enjoy it, but the third? Well. I guess not  having Spielberg on board didn't help. Alas, Spielberg was the executive producer for this film, and needless to say, the third probably would've been much more enjoyable had he worked on it. This film was GREAT! It was the type of film that they made movie theaters for. It was loud, terrifying and fast-paced, which will help keep your grandpa awake as the film progresses. Although the story is pretty predictable, the cinematography and action scenes make up for it. The two kids in the movie don't really help the story progress in any way, they did set up one of the coolest scenes in the movie. I won't spoil it for you though. Well, here are my final thoughts on the movie:

Went in with very low expectations and came out very pleasantly surprised. My favorite JP movie after the original and im actually hoping for more. It doesn't have the awe and spectacle of the original but it came close for me.
Jurassic World, Settles in nicely with the Original Trilogy, Originally thought to be a Reboot by many, the film proves that to be wrong, having many nice nods for fans of the Original movie.
Welcome back to a Stephen Spielberg type of movie.
Enjoyed greatly, the 4th and probally last jurassic park movie is defiently worth seeing. The movie is great for anyone a fan of dinosaurs. I would recommend this movie for everyone 8+

This movie is definitely the 2nd best Jurassic Park movie but considering Lost World and 3 that's not much of  an achievement. The cgi looks like it was made by 3 year old`s but the actual dinosaur segments are pretty cool. And the dinosaur fight  is pretty cool. So in conclusion I think its pretty good but I can see why people won`t like it.
A very good film especially in 3D. The CGI effects were amazing and the story is ok. However some of the design looks more of a copy and paste from the older jurassic parks.
Entertaining, but a little drawn out and too much CGI.

I've never seen the Jurassic Park franchise, until this moment. In the box office they obviously succeeded and even exceeded but talking overall I found this world to be entertaining until some point. I bet that 90's lovers found the visual effects amazing but I don't know... it was still kind of expected that the plot was going to be the dinosaurs freaking out. The good news are that I found this movie for a whole new generation something satisfying and cool during its moments and a thing to behold for Jurassic Park Lovers. It's a great pop-corn movie (67%)

Jurassic World shows an undeniably wrong sequel for a saga like Jurassic Park's and also sins. But anyway, it shows a wonderfully talented cast, thrilling storytelling and enjoyable visual effects. The result: a satisfying new adventure that continues Steven Spielberg's classic trilogy.

Jurassic World is dumb fun at its dumbest and sometimes at its funnest. It tries to be smart, but then it starts being the thing the movie is spreading a message against. It's hypocrisy in cinematic form.
